<<<<<<< SEARCH
    // GDSF with frequency aging: track frequency and size for each object.
    struct CacheObject {
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t size;
        uint64_t timestamp;
        std::set<std::tuple<double, uint64_t, obj_id_t>>::iterator pqit;
    };
    // Priority queue node: tuple for easy erase and reinsert
    // (priority, timestamp, obj_id)
    std::set<std::tuple<double, uint64_t, obj_id_t>> priority_set;
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, CacheObject> cache_map;
    uint64_t counter = 0;
    double last_evict_pri = 0.0;

    // Slightly decrease freq on every eviction to "age" frequency counts
    // Use a lighter aging: only reduce for large frequencies to avoid excessive churn for small objects
    void age_frequencies() {
        for (auto& kv : cache_map) {
            if (kv.second.freq > 8) kv.second.freq = (kv.second.freq * 7) / 8;
        }
    }

    // Reduce recency bonus to avoid bias toward new objects
    double calc_pri(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
        if (size == 0) return last_evict_pri + freq * 1e6;
        return last_evict_pri + double(freq) * 1e6 / size + 0.001 * counter;
    }
=======
    // GDSF with frequency aging: track frequency and size for each object.
    struct CacheObject {
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t size;
        uint64_t timestamp;
        std::set<std::tuple<double, uint64_t, obj_id_t>>::iterator pqit;
    };
    // Priority queue node: tuple for easy erase and reinsert
    // (priority, timestamp, obj_id)
    std::set<std::tuple<double, uint64_t, obj_id_t>> priority_set;
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, CacheObject> cache_map;
    uint64_t counter = 0;
    double last_evict_pri = 0.0;

    // Frequency aging not used for best GDSF fitness; prefer purity of frequency+size.
    void age_frequencies() {}

    // Remove recency bonus from priority. Strict GDSF for improved fitness.
    double calc_pri(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
        if (size == 0) return last_evict_pri + freq * 1e6;
        return last_evict_pri + double(freq) * 1e6 / size;
    }

<<<<<<< SEARCH
    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (priority_set.empty()) return 0;
        auto it = priority_set.begin();
        obj_id_t victim = std::get<2>(*it);
        last_evict_pri = std::get<0>(*it);
        priority_set.erase(it);
        cache_map.erase(victim);
        // Age all frequencies to prevent stale frequency dominance
        // Only do frequency aging every N evictions to reduce overhead for large caches
        static uint64_t evict_count = 0;
        if (++evict_count % 7 == 0) {
            age_frequencies();
            // Recompute priorities for all objects after frequency aging
            for (auto& kv : cache_map) {
                priority_set.erase(kv.second.pqit);
                double new_pri = calc_pri(kv.second.freq, kv.second.size);
                kv.second.pqit = priority_set.insert({new_pri, kv.second.timestamp, kv.first}).first;
            }
        }
        return victim;
    }

    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (priority_set.empty()) return 0;
        auto it = priority_set.begin();
        obj_id_t victim = std::get<2>(*it);
        last_evict_pri = std::get<0>(*it);
        priority_set.erase(it);
        cache_map.erase(victim);
        // No frequency aging, strict GDSF for best results.
        return victim;
    }
